Uses of CallbackModes in org.apache.openjpa.event
 

Classes in org.apache.openjpa.event that implement CallbackModes
 class LifecycleEventManager
          Manager that can be used to track and notify listeners on lifecycle events.
 

Uses of CallbackModes in org.apache.openjpa.kernel
 

Subinterfaces of CallbackModes in org.apache.openjpa.kernel
 interface Broker
          The broker is the primary interface into the OpenJPA runtime.
 

Classes in org.apache.openjpa.kernel that implement CallbackModes
 class BrokerImpl
          Concrete Broker.
 class DelegatingBroker
          Delegating broker that can also perform exception translation for use in facades.
 class FinalizingBrokerImpl
          Subtype of BrokerImpl that automatically closes itself during finalization.

Subinterfaces of CallbackModes in org.apache.openjpa.meta

          Populates new metadata with default values.
 

Classes in org.apache.openjpa.meta that implement CallbackModes
 class AbstractMetaDataDefaults
          Abstract implementation provides a set of generic utilities for detecting persistence meta-data of Field/Member.
 class NoneMetaDataFactory
          No-op metadata I/O to prevent attempts to load other classes.

Subinterfaces of CallbackModes in org.apache.openjpa.slice

          Extension to Broker to allow dynamically add/remove slices.
 

Classes in org.apache.openjpa.slice that implement CallbackModes
 class DistributedBrokerImpl
          A specialized Broker to associate slice identifiers with the StateManagers as they are persisted in a cascade.

Classes in org.apache.openjpa.validation that implement CallbackModes

          An extension of LifecycleEventManager which adds validation capabilities for specific lifecycle events.
